text:
Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another
episode of Nerdy Nummies!

Ro: I got so many requests to do something
again with liquid nitrogen, so
Ro: I brought my friend Rich. Rich: Hello.

Ro: He’s from out of the box mods, I’ll
put a link down below so you can

Ro: go check it out. But he basically makes
the craziest, coolest custom computers

Ro: ever! He made my computer, and he made
my roommates, Husky Starcraft.

Ro: So I’ll put a bunch of pictures up in
here right now so you can see all

Ro: these cool pictures going on. You also
might recognize him from the covers

Ro: of CPU Magazine. And we actually met at a
convention, he’s at conventions a lot.

Ro: Which ones do you go to? Rich: Yeah, well
first of all if you see me out

Rich: at conventions, I usually go by Darth
Beavis, I'm known by that across the world.

Ro: Yes, AKA Darth Beavis! Rich: And uh, I
love to go to gaming conventions, so

Rich: uh, PAX, QuakeCon, BlizzCon, And then
my favorite LAN party of all that

Rich: Husky Starcraft and I both came from, PDX
LAN, the creme de la creme of all
Rich: LAN Parties.

Ro: So today, we are going to be working with
liquid nitrogen again, and we’re

Ro: gonna be making Dippin Dots. Rich: Mmmm!
Ro: Let’s get started!
Rich: Whoa!

Ro: What you will need, will be: 4 medical
syringes, I ordered the 60 CCs,

Ro: and… Rich: And, so we will have 4 yummy
flavors of colorful ice cream, and we

Rich: will have 4 styrofoam bowls, the reason
we use these bowls is because

Rich: we need them for the next ingredient,
these are insulated bowls, they’re

Rich: not metal so they won’t get super,
super cold and allow us to work with it.

Rich: The last ingredient is liquid nitrogen!
Ro: Ta-der!

Ro: Pretty cool, I learned that in High School,
science class,

Ro: styrofoam are insulators. The types
of ice cream that we got are strawberry,

Ro: chocolate, vanilla and mint chocolate
chip. Alright, let’s get started!

Ro: The first thing that we will be doing,
we are going to take your bowl of

Ro: ice cream and microwave it for about 30 seconds,
so that, it’s like soup, hot soup.

Rich: Now that we’ve worked very diligently
in getting the ice cream melted…

Ro: Boom! We got our safety glasses, about to put ‘em
on, before Rich pours all this

Ro: liquid nitrogen. And we’re gonna fill
it about 1/2 way?

Rich: Well, there abouts… Ro: About 1/2
way.

Ro: OK, so what you’re gonna do is, here
I’ll give you a syringe, you’re gonna

Ro: take off the top, take off the little
needle top, like so, then we’re gonna

Ro: stick the syringe into the ice cream and
suck it up!

Ro: Then you’re gonna attach the needle
again, like so.
Ro: Yay cheers! Rich: Cheers! Ro: Dippin Dots!

Ro: Then you’re just gonna take your syringe
and gently push out a little drip, and

Ro: it will make a little ball. And then we’re
gonna do this for the other
Ro: ice cream colors.

Rich: We filled these 1/2 full with liquid
nitrogen. Ro: Mmmhmm.

Rich: And you can keep making Dippin Dots
until you’re out of ice cream.

Rich: The liquid nitrogen will eventually
evaporate, leaving you only with

Rich: Dippin Dots. At that point you should
probably stick them in the freezer
Rich: or consume them. Ro: Om-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom!
Rich: Om-nom-nom! Ro: Nom-nom-nom!
Ro: Om-nom-nom, nom-nom-nom, nom-nom,nom!

Rich: What’s really nice about doing this
is you can make it without any artificial

Rich: colors, flavors or preservatives. So you
could make it totally healthy, you

Rich: could make it with sugar free. Ro: Mmmhmm.
Rich: So you could have it

Rich: meet all your dietary needs without
having to go buy something off the shelf.

Rich: Plus you get the added benefit of making
something yourself.

Ro: Making the little dots takes a little
bit of time, so just be patient,

Ro: go at a good pace. If you go too
fast, they won’t look like dots,

Ro: they’ll clump together, and they’ll
kind of look like a blob.

Rich: Just put some Justin Bieber on and enjoy
yourself.

Ro: Ta-da! We finished all the Dippin Dots!
They look awesome!

Rich: So as soon as the liquid nitrogen evaporates,
just shake, shake, shake…

Both: Shake, shake, shake! Rich: Shake your
bootay!

Rich: And it will separate all the Dippin
Dots.

Ro: That looks so cool, alright, and now it’s
time, we can take a spoon,

Ro: take our spoons. Rich: There is no spoon.
Ro: Ha-ha-ha how did you do that?

Ro: And then just scoop ‘em up and put them
in your little ice cream.
Ro: Oh that’s funny, they stuck to the spoon.

Rich: Go for some green. Ro: Oh yeah! Little
nilla… Come here!
Rich: All the colors of the rainbow. Ro: Yum-yum-yum-yum-yum!
Ro: These are pretty good.

Ro: Fwa-dah! Here’s our little cups of Dippin
Dots! Da-dee!

Ro: Cheers Rich, we did a good job. Thank
you Rich for coming,

Ro: I really appreciate it. Rich: I had an
awesome Nerdy Time, thank you.
Ro: Aw, right on! Neah!

Ro: If you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

Ro: leave me a comment below and I will do
my best to make them happen.
Ro: OK, thanks so much! Bye-bye!
Ro: Bye guys! Rich: Hasta la bye-bye!

Ro: Oh gosh I can’t wait… Oh gosh they’re
so good! Rich: Those are awesome!
